trans-unit.source: Defines a structure that holds the raw data for a performance counter.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Diagnostics.CounterSample"></xref> structure and sets the <xref:System.Diagnostics.CounterSample.CounterTimeStamp*> property to 0 (zero).
Use this constructor to take an initial sample of the performance counter.
The System Monitor supplies values for these parameters automatically when you call the <xref:System.Diagnostics.PerformanceCounter.NextSample%2A> method for the first time.
The numeric value associated with the performance counter sample.
An optional, base raw value for the counter, to use only if the sample is based on multiple counters.
The frequency with which the counter is read.
The frequency with which the system reads from the counter.
The raw time stamp.
The raw, high-fidelity time stamp.
A <xref href="System.Diagnostics.PerformanceCounterType"></xref> object that indicates the type of the counter for which this sample is a snapshot.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Diagnostics.CounterSample"></xref> structure and sets the <xref:System.Diagnostics.CounterSample.CounterTimeStamp*> property to the value that is passed in.
Use this constructor to take samples after you have already taken an initial sample of the performance counter.
The System Monitor supplies values for these parameters automatically when you call the <xref:System.Diagnostics.PerformanceCounter.NextSample%2A> method.
The numeric value associated with the performance counter sample.
An optional, base raw value for the counter, to use only if the sample is based on multiple counters.
The frequency with which the counter is read.
The frequency with which the system reads from the counter.
The raw time stamp.
The raw, high-fidelity time stamp.
A <xref href="System.Diagnostics.PerformanceCounterType"></xref> object that indicates the type of the counter for which this sample is a snapshot.
The time at which the sample was taken.
Gets an optional, base raw value for the counter.
The base raw value, which is used only if the sample is based on multiple counters.
Calculates the performance data of the counter, using a single sample point.
This method is generally used for uncalculated performance counter types.
The <xref href="System.Diagnostics.CounterSample"></xref> structure to use as a base point for calculating performance data.
The calculated performance value.
Calculates the performance data of the counter, using two sample points.
This method is generally used for calculated performance counter types, such as averages.
The <xref href="System.Diagnostics.CounterSample"></xref> structure to use as a base point for calculating performance data.
The <xref href="System.Diagnostics.CounterSample"></xref> structure to use as an ending point for calculating performance data.
The calculated performance value.
Gets the raw counter frequency.
The frequency with which the counter is read.
Gets the counter's time stamp.
The time at which the sample was taken.
Gets the performance counter type.
A <xref href="System.Diagnostics.PerformanceCounterType"></xref> object that indicates the type of the counter for which this sample is a snapshot.
Defines an empty, uninitialized performance counter sample of type <xref uid="langword_csharp_NumberOfItems32" name="NumberOfItems32" href=""></xref>.
To be added.
Indicates whether the specified <xref href="System.Diagnostics.CounterSample"></xref> structure is equal to the current <xref href="System.Diagnostics.CounterSample"></xref> structure.
Two <xref:System.Diagnostics.CounterSample> structures are equal if they have identical property values.
The <xref href="System.Diagnostics.CounterSample"></xref> structure to be compared with this instance.
if sample is equal to the current instance; otherwise, .

Indicates whether the specified structure is a <xref href="System.Diagnostics.CounterSample"></xref> structure and is identical to the current <xref href="System.Diagnostics.CounterSample"></xref> structure.
Two <xref:System.Diagnostics.CounterSample> structures are equal if they have identical property values.
The <xref href="System.Diagnostics.CounterSample"></xref> structure to be compared with the current structure.
if o is a structure and is identical to the current instance; otherwise, .
Gets a hash code for the current counter sample.
A hash code for the current counter sample.
Returns a value that indicates whether two <xref href="System.Diagnostics.CounterSample"></xref> structures are equal.
Two <xref:System.Diagnostics.CounterSample> structures are equal if they have identical property values.
A <xref href="System.Diagnostics.CounterSample"></xref> structure.
Another <xref href="System.Diagnostics.CounterSample"></xref> structure to be compared to the structure specified by the `a` parameter.
if a and b are equal; otherwise, .
Returns a value that indicates whether two <xref href="System.Diagnostics.CounterSample"></xref> structures are not equal.
Two <xref:System.Diagnostics.CounterSample> structures are not equal if any of their property values are different.
A <xref href="System.Diagnostics.CounterSample"></xref> structure.
Another <xref href="System.Diagnostics.CounterSample"></xref> structure to be compared to the structure specified by the `a` parameter.
if a and b are not equal; otherwise,
Gets the raw value of the counter.
The numeric value that is associated with the performance counter sample.
Gets the raw system frequency.
The frequency with which the system reads from the counter.
Gets the raw time stamp.
The system time stamp.
Gets the raw, high-fidelity time stamp.
The system time stamp, represented within 0.1 millisecond.
